event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: The platform administrator should investigate the cause of the boot problem and schedule a service action. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: Failure to boot %DISTRO% on a domain using a device behind a PCI-Express switch chip. This includes PCI-X slot and internal I/O devices (if the PCI-Express switch chip is located on an IOU), and the PCI-Express slots and PCI-X slots on an I/O Boat (if the PCI-Express switch chip is located on an I/O Boat).
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
This message indicates a failure to boot %DISTRO% on a domain using a device on the PCI-Express switch.
The OpenBoot PROM fcode did not detect any fault with the device.
The domain drops to the OpenBoot PROM 'ok' prompt.
The precise cause of the failure to boot cannot be determined.
The cause may be some;
Difficult-to-diagnose hardware problem. Corrupted boot image. External problem.
The administrator should investigate the cause of the boot problem and schedule a service action.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The domain drops to the OpenBoot PROM 'ok' prompt.
